(0, 3065).name: United Nations
(0, 3065).label: provider
(0, 3065).description: An international organization dedicated to promoting peace, security, and cooperation among its member states, and addressing global challenges such as climate change and sustainable development

(0, 3065).name: Sustainable Development Goals
(0, 3065).label: project
(0, 3065).description: A set of 17 goals adopted by the United Nations to achieve sustainable development, addressing issues such as poverty, hunger, climate change, and inequality

(0, 3065).name: climate change
(0, 3065).label: natural hazard
(0, 3065).description: A global phenomenon characterized by the warming of the Earth's atmosphere, leading to more frequent and severe weather events, and having significant impacts on ecosystems and human societies

(0, 3065).name: poverty
(0, 3065).label: variable
(0, 3065).description: A state of economic deprivation, characterized by a lack of access to basic needs such as food, water, shelter, and healthcare

(0, 3065).name: food security
(0, 3065).label: variable
(0, 3065).description: A condition in which all people have access to sufficient, safe, and nutritious food to lead active and healthy lives

(0, 3065).name: human settlements
(0, 3065).label: location
(0, 3065).description: Urban or rural areas where people live, work, and interact, often characterized by a concentration of population, infrastructure, and economic activity

(0, 3065).name: biodiversity
(0, 3065).label: variable
(0, 3065).description: The variety of different plants, animals, and microorganisms that live in an ecosystem or on Earth as a whole, and the ecological complexes they form

(2582, 5810).name: anthropogenic influence
(2582, 5810).label: variable
(2582, 5810).description: Human-induced factors that affect the environment, such as greenhouse gas emissions and pollution

(2582, 5810).name: climate change
(2582, 5810).label: teleconnection
(2582, 5810).description: A long-term change in the Earth's climate, resulting from natural and anthropogenic factors, with significant impacts on the environment and human societies

(2582, 5810).name: greenhouse gas emissions
(2582, 5810).label: variable
(2582, 5810).description: The release of gases such as carbon dioxide and methane into the atmosphere, contributing to global warming and climate change

(2582, 5810).name: extreme events
(2582, 5810).label: weather event
(2582, 5810).description: Unusual and severe meteorological occurrences, such as heatwaves, floods, and storms, often exacerbated by climate change

(2582, 5810).name: agriculture
(2582, 5810).label: platform
(2582, 5810).description: The practice of cultivating the soil, growing crops, and raising livestock, which is vulnerable to the impacts of climate change

(2582, 5810).name: SDGs
(2582, 5810).label: project
(2582, 5810).description: The United Nations Sustainable Development Goals, a set of 17 objectives aimed at promoting sustainable development and addressing global challenges

(2582, 5810).name: Hamburg University of Applied Sciences
(2582, 5810).label: provider
(2582, 5810).description: A German university that has contributed to the Encyclopedia of the UN Sustainable Development Goals

(5203, 7721).name: Sustainable Development Goals
(5203, 7721).label: project
(5203, 7721).description: A set of 17 goals adopted by the United Nations to promote sustainable development and address global challenges such as poverty, inequality, and climate change

(5203, 7721).name: climate change
(5203, 7721).label: natural hazard
(5203, 7721).description: A long-term change in the Earth's climate, primarily caused by human activities such as burning fossil fuels, deforestation, and pollution

(5203, 7721).name: Turkey
(5203, 7721).label: location
(5203, 7721).description: A country located in Western Asia and Southeastern Europe, known for its diverse culture, history, and geography

(5203, 7721).name: World Bank
(5203, 7721).label: provider
(5203, 7721).description: An international financial institution that provides financial and technical assistance to developing countries to promote economic development and reduce poverty

(5203, 7721).name: sustainability
(5203, 7721).label: variable
(5203, 7721).description: The ability to maintain or support a process without depleting natural resources, with a focus on environmental, social, and economic aspects
